lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "The market was looking for a reason to knock itself down a little bit, and with the trade sanctions coming largely as a surprise, this was the think the market attached itself to," said Gary Ciminero of Fleet Financial Group.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Business conditions seem to be getting better according to what he hears from a broad cross-section of companies, from retailers to machinery manufacturers.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: He said over the weekend, investors pondered President Reagan's decision to impose tariffs on Japanese electronic goods and some concluded the step could signal the beginning of a trade war.
